p: The Hawaiian monk seal is among the rarest of pinnipeds, with approximately 1200 individuals remaining throughout the Hawaiian Archipelago [ 148]. Currently, infectious disease is not known to be limiting monk seal recovery, and serology and post mortem results indicate that the population is na√Øve to PDV [ 149]. However, the species has extremely low genetic diversity [ 150], and although their susceptibility to morbilliviruses is unknown, DMV and CDV have been reported in cetaceans and domestic dogs in the Hawaiian Islands [ 25] and vagrant pinnipeds from the eastern North Pacific, where PDV has recently been reported [ 117], have been observed on Hawaiian beaches.
